p: However, we are wary of excluding genes from our analyses that have premature stop codons and other sequence features of pseudogenes because such genes may maintain tumor suppressor functions. For example, we have identified duplicate TP53 retrogenes (TP53TRGs) in elephants, all of which encode premature stop codons suggesting they are pseudogenes. However, these TP53TRGs are expressed, encode functional separation of function mutants of the ancestral TP53 gene, and contribute to enhanced DNA damage sensitivity in elephant cells.
